page.title: 15Ditchingham Hall (part 1)
page.content: The hall was built in 1711 in the reign of Queen Anne.Its imposing presence,lieing in front of a lake & in the centre of a park landscaped by Capability Brown,makes it one of the most beautiful houses in Norfolk & important part of the nation's heritage.In 1984 some 30,000 tons of silt were removed from the lake when it was cleaned out. At the same time the Hall was reduced in size by eliminating the unnecessary -and the architecturally unaesthetic- parts of the building & the interior was modernised in order to make it as labour-saving as possible.The lead & slate roof was renewed & the Hall is now heated by straw.This recent innovation enables heat to be provided by the waste products of agriculture. {Ditchingham Hall continued on page 16 { }
